posts.post_content:
Ajani can equal an auto-win if you use [Mayael's Aria](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mayael's Aria).  
Activate Mayael's Aria, with your life at 20 or more. Summon Ajani. Use Ajani's -6. You now have a 20/20+ creature. Wait until your next turn, and due to Mayael's Aria, you have just won.

Posted By: BlueInkAlchemist (2/7/2011 8:18:25 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
A friend and I each pulled one of these at a prerelease. He kept going on about its ultimate, which struck me as odd.  
  
Ajani's ultimate should be the last reason you use him. Instead, he should be used as a continuous [Glorious Anthem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glorious Anthem) that boosts your creatures when it comes into play. Spam his -1 ability three times, then gain life, then use the -1 ability again. Your creatures will become enormous and there will be little your opponent can do about it short of mass removal, which still leaves you with an advantage, as Ajani will still be around to pump himself (and your life total) before you cast a creature again, at which point you'll be able to -1 once more, repeating the cycle.  
  
So yeah.
posts.html:
A friend and I each pulled one of these at a prerelease. He kept going on about its ultimate, which struck me as odd.

Ajani's ultimate should be the last reason you use him. Instead, he should be used as a continuous Glorious Anthem that boosts your creatures when it comes into play. Spam his -1 ability three times, then gain life, then use the -1 ability again. Your creatures will become enormous and there will be little your opponent can do about it short of mass removal, which still leaves you with an advantage, as Ajani will still be around to pump himself (and your life total) before you cast a creature again, at which point you'll be able to -1 once more, repeating the cycle.

So yeah.

Posted By: crystalisdraco (12/9/2010 2:00:47 PM)

@FaceClaimer - No, Essence Backlash only counters spells and the token that is created from this card is done so through an ability and not a spell. However, you might want to check out Essence Backlash's namesake, Backlash. (Also see: Delirium)

In my playgroup Backlash and Delerium are both very common spells, so when someone wants to play this or Serra Avatar or some other ridiculously large creature they always need to check which players are using black and red and think hard about that decision, otherwise they can end up dead very, very quickly.

As for Ajani, as others have said the middle ability is the main attraction here. I have always overlooked this guy in the past because the other two abilities are kind of underwhelming to me, but now that I'm sitting here giving him some real thought that low costed middle ability and 4 starting loyalty are starting to look pretty attractive. Too bad I ... (see all)

Posted By: FaceClaimer (12/18/2012 11:53:42 AM)

posts.post_content:
@CthuvianAce  
  
Better than that — read both cards again. All you need is a life total of 9 before the Aria's effects kick in. This is how it works. (minimum p/t of avatar also shown)  
  
1) Activate Ajani's -6 when you're at no less than 9 life with the Aria out. 9/9  
2) Wait until your next turn as long as your life stays at 9 or above. 9/9  
3) On your upkeep, the avatar token gets a +1/+1 counter. 10/10  
4) Now you have a 10 power creature, so you gain 10 life. The avatar *gains power accordingly* due to how its ability is worded. 20/20  
5) You win.
posts.html:
